sentences.en: After her mother's death, Sara clung to her aunt more than ever.
sentences.cn: 萨拉在母亲去世后比以往任何时候都更依附于她的姨妈。

sentences.en: Another congressman clung on with a majority of only 18.
sentences.cn: 另一位国会议员在获得仅仅18张多数票的情况下保住了位子。

sentences.en: Another man was rescued as he clung to the riverbank.
sentences.cn: 另一个男人因为紧紧抓住了河堤而被救了。

sentences.en: Do not cling to him or allow him to cling to you.
sentences.cn: 别离不开他,也别让他离不开你.

sentences.en: He appears determined to cling to power.
sentences.cn: 看来他决心要抓住权力不放。

sentences.en: He does not cling to classical with a physical problem.
sentences.cn: 他遇到物理问题时,从不拘泥于权威性原理.

sentences.en: He managed to cling on to a ledge 40ft down the rock face.
sentences.cn: 他设法紧紧地攀在了距岩壁顶端40英尺的岩礁上。

sentences.en: His wet shirt clung to his body.
sentences.cn: 他的湿衬衫紧紧地贴在身上。

sentences.en: Instead, he appears determined to cling to power.
sentences.cn: 反而，他看来坚决要握紧权力不放。

sentences.en: It is dangerous to cling to outdated ideas and theories.
sentences.cn: 坚持过时的观点和理论是很危险的.

sentences.en: Members of a family should cling together in times of trouble.
sentences.cn: 一家人应该患难与共.

sentences.en: She had to cling onto the door handle until the pain passed.
sentences.cn: 她只好紧紧握住门把手，直到不疼了才松开。

sentences.en: She had to cling onto the doorhandle until the pain passed.
sentences.cn: 她不得不抓紧门把手，直到那阵疼痛过去。

sentences.en: Some children tend to cling on their first day at school.
sentences.cn: 有些小孩在上学第一天往往会有恋家的情绪。

sentences.en: Some people had to cling to trees as the flash flood bowled them over.
sentences.cn: 一些人不得不紧紧抱住树干，因为湍急的洪水会把他们冲倒。

sentences.en: The birds cling to the wall and nibble at the brickwork.
sentences.cn: 鸟儿们紧贴在墙上，啄着砖缝。

sentences.en: The fused particles cling together.
sentences.cn: 熔化的微粒子粘在一起。

sentences.en: They caused her to cling closer to things she possessed.
sentences.cn: 有一首短歌那位年轻的小姐弹得特别温柔缠绵.

sentences.en: They know scholars reject their legend, but they still cling to their belief.
sentences.cn: 尽管知道学者们不相信他们的传说，他们还是坚持自己的信仰。

sentences.en: Throughout the trial she had clung to the belief that he was innocent.
sentences.cn: 在整个审判中，她都坚持相信他是清白的。

sentences.en: Wet clothes cling to the body.
sentences.cn: 湿衣服贴身.

sentences.en: Whenever we move to a new house, we always cling to far too many possessions.
sentences.cn: 我们每次搬家时, 总是保留过多的东西.

trans.tran_cn: 抓紧，黏附，缠住，坚持（观念或行为方式）
trans.tran_en: to stick to someone or something, or seem to surround them

trans.tran_cn: 紧紧抓住； 黏着， 挨近； 依附， 依恋； 坚持， 墨守， 忠实于
trans.tran_en: to hold someone or something tightly, especially because you do not feel safe
